pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:0.5: 9. The training rule on telling about what is grave
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.2: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was quarreling with the monks from the group of six.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.3: At that time Upananda committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He then asked the Sangha for probation for that offense,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.5: Just then an association in Sāvatthī was offering a meal to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.6: Because Upananda was on probation, he was seated on the last seat in the dining hall.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.7: The monks from the group of six then told those lay followers,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.8: “This Venerable Upananda, the esteemed associate of your families, eats the food given in faith with the same hand he uses to emit semen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.9: After committing an offense of intentional emission of semen, he asked the Sangha for probation for that offense,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.11: And because he’s on probation, he’s seated on the last seat in the dining hall.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.12: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.13: “How can the monks from the group of six tell a person who’s not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.14: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.17: “… Foolish men, how can you tell a person who’s not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.18: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.19: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.20.1: ‘If a monk tells a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.8: the four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.9: A person who is not fully ordained:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.10: anyone except a fully ordained monk and a fully ordained nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.12: tells a woman or a man or a lay person or a monastic.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.13: Except if the monks have agreed:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.15.1: There is permission of the monks with a limit on offenses, but not on families.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.16: There is permission of the monks with a limit on families, but not on offenses. There is permission of the monks with a limit both on offenses and on families. There is permission of the monks with a limit neither on offenses nor on families.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.18: offenses are specified: “These particular offenses can be informed about.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.20: families are specified: “These particular families can be informed.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.21: With a limit both on offenses and on families:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.22: both offenses and families are specified: “These particular offenses can be informed about, and these particular families can be informed.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.23: With a limit neither on offenses nor on families:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.24: neither offenses nor families are specified in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.25.1: When there is a limit on offenses, if he tells about other offenses than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.26: When there is a limit on families, if he tells other families than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.27: When there is a limit both on offenses and on families, if he tells about other offenses than those that are specified and he tells other families than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.28: When there is a limit neither on offenses nor on families, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.1: If the offense is grave, and he perceives it as such, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.2: If the offense is grave, but he is unsure of it, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.3: If the offense is grave, but he perceives it as minor, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.4: If he tells about a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.5: If he tells about the misconduct of a person who is not fully ordained, whether grave or minor, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.6: If the offense is minor, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.7: If the offense is minor, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.8: If the offense is minor, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.2: if he tells about the action that was the basis for the offense, but not the class of offense;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.3: if he tells about the class of offense, but not the action that was the basis for the offense;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.7: The ninth rule, the training rule on telling about what is grave, is finished.
